questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: 1) Learn R coding and learn to produce nice looking figures in R. 2) Learn Github and be inspired to change how I handle document versions.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: Become more confident in R and to learn more about effective project management

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I am interesting in learning advanced methods in managing my data and learn how to perform reproducible data analysis

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I believe that this course will be a good start point to learn how to properly handle with my own mass spectrometry data

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I need to learn a statistic program for analysing my data collected in my PhD project. I have been recommended to use R, and I think that is the right way to go.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I wan to learn R for to be able to do statistical analysis and for use in my research.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I want to be able to analyze and visualize my data in R, in order to be more reproducible and well explained.

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?
responses: I want to become better at analyzing my data. Also use some packages and tools that require R knowledge

questions: Why do you want to attend this course?

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: All links worked fine and tasks were easy to follow. I feel I now have the very basic concepts for learning R.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: All the information and set-up. Fantastic materials.  First I was thinking, it was written very detailed, but when you start the process that is perfect!

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: All the instructions or commands provided in the pre-course tasks worked well.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?
responses: Detailed description on how to interpret the coding. Great videos.

responses: Everything was fairly smooth.

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

questions: In your opinion, what worked well?

questions: What do you expect to learn and what would you like to be able to do with what you've learned?

How to upload my data to the program (from excel and RedCap), how to analyse the basic statistic formulas (mean, median, t-test, SD, confidence interval) and how to create some statistic figures useful for publication (plots, graph, charts). And then I expect to learn something new and hopefully very useful in my further research career (both statistic and when writing articles and collaborate with other)
